Interface GenericTypeValidator<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type modelled by the GenericType object. For example, the type of String.class is GenericType<String>. Use GenericType<?> if the type being modeled is unknown.
All Superinterfaces:
ObjectComponent<GenericTypeValidator<T>, GenericType<T>>, ValidatorComponent<GenericTypeValidator<T>, GenericType<T>>
public interface GenericTypeValidator<T> extends ValidatorComponent<GenericTypeValidator<T>, GenericType<T>>, ObjectComponent<GenericTypeValidator<T>, GenericType<T>>
Validates the state of a GenericType.
See Also:
  • GenericType<T>

  • Method Details

    • isPrimitive

      GenericTypeValidator<T> isPrimitive()
      Ensures that the value is a primitive type.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the value is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is not a primitive type
      See Also:
      • Class.isPrimitive()

    • isSupertypeOf

      <U> GenericTypeValidator<U> isSupertypeOf(Class<? extends U> type)
      Ensures that the value is a superclass or superinterface of subtype.
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type to compare to
      Parameters:
      type - the type to compare to. For types that contain type-parameters, use the TypeToken overload.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the value or type are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is not a supertype of subtype

    • isSupertypeOf

      <U> GenericTypeValidator<U> isSupertypeOf(GenericType<? extends U> subtype)
      Ensures that the value is a superclass or superinterface of subtype.
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type to compare to
      Parameters:
      subtype - the type to compare to. For types without type-parameters, prefer the * Class overload.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the value or type are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is not a supertype of subtype

    • isSubtypeOf

      <U> GenericTypeValidator<U> isSubtypeOf(Class<? super U> supertype)
      Ensures that the value is a subclass or subinterface of supertype.
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type to compare to
      Parameters:
      supertype - the type to compare to. For types that contain type-parameters, use the TypeToken overload.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the value or type are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is not a subtype of supertype

    • isSubtypeOf

      <U> GenericTypeValidator<U> isSubtypeOf(GenericType<? super U> supertype)
      Ensures that the value is a subclass or subinterface of supertype.
      Type Parameters:
      U - the type to compare to
      Parameters:
      supertype - the type to compare to. For types without type-parameters, prefer the Class overload.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the value or type are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if value is not a subtype of supertype
